definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: Factorization of this equation by trial and error is not possible.
sentences.chinese: 用試湊法對這個方程進行因式分解是不可能奏效的。

sentences.english: The algorithm relies on a QR factorization approach to the least-squares detection problem.
sentences.chinese: 該算法利用QR因式分解以解決最小二乘方探測問題。

sentences.english: Two methods area) optimizing factorization to decrease the error of rounding operations.
sentences.chinese: 優化因式分解，以減少取整誤差的引入。

sentences.english: Jacobian Matrix splitting and approximate factorization are used for solving obtained implicit difference equations.
sentences.chinese: 對差分方程之隱式部分利用了近似因式分解法。

definition: common factor/common divisor (of a math. expression)
elimination (math)/to eliminate one variable from equations
